query: iphone 16 pro max price in india
raw_content: {"user_query": "iphone 16 pro max price in india", "answer": "The iPhone 16 Pro Max was released on September 9, 2024. In India, its price ranges from approximately ₹1,34,900 for the 256GB variant to ₹1,79,900 for the 1TB variant.", "products": [{"name": "iPhone 16 Pro Max", "description": "Released on September 9, 2024. Features a 6.9-inch Super Retina XDR OLED display with a 120Hz ProMotion refresh rate and is powered by the Apple A18 Pro chip. It includes a triple camera system with a 48MP main sensor, a 12MP ultra-wide lens, and a 12MP telephoto lens with 5x optical zoom. In India, the 256GB variant is available for approximately ₹1,34,900 or ₹1,44,900; the 512GB variant is listed at around ₹1,54,900; and the 1TB variant can be found for approximately ₹1,69,900 or ₹1,79,900.", "price": "₹1,34,900 onwards", "review_rating": null, "review_pros": [], "review_cons": []}]}

Key considerations for choosing include cushioning for shock absorption, a comfortable and secure fit with a roomy toe box, durable materials, and suitability for your specific running style and foot type.   "answer": "The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra and Google Pixel 9 Pro are both flagship smartphones offering distinct advantages. The S24 Ultra excels with its powerful Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor, a brighter and more durable display, faster charging, and the integrated S Pen. The Pixel 9 Pro focuses on a refined Android experience with Google's Tensor G4 chip, superior computational photography, advanced AI features, and promises 7 years of OS updates. In India, the S24 Ultra starts from ₹99,989, while the Pixel 9 Pro is available from approximately ₹87,500.",

Query: samsung s24 ultra vs pixel 9 pro comparison

query: samsung s24 ultra vs pixel 9 pro comparison
raw_content:
{
  "user_query": "samsung s24 ultra vs pixel 9 pro comparison",
  "answer": "The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra and Google Pixel 9 Pro are both leading Android flagships offering cutting-edge technology. The S24 Ultra, released in January 2024, is powered by a robust Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor, features a versatile 200MP quad-camera system with an S Pen, and boasts a bright 6.8-inch QHD+ display. The Pixel 9 Pro, released in September 2024, features Google's Tensor G4 processor and focuses on an advanced AI-driven camera experience that often produces superior image quality, along with a potentially more ergonomic design and a more competitive price point. Both devices promise 7 years of OS and security updates. The choice between them largely depends on whether you prioritize raw processing power and S Pen functionality (S24 Ultra) or superior computational photography, AI features, and value (Pixel 9 Pro).",
  "products": [
    {
      "name": "Samsung S24 Ultra",
      "description": "The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra features a 6.8-inch QHD+ Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with a 120Hz refresh rate and 2600 nits peak brightness, protected by Gorilla Armor. It has a titanium frame and is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 for Galaxy. Its quad-camera system includes a 200MP main lens, 12MP ultra-wide, 10MP 3x telephoto, and 50MP 5x telephoto. It comes with a 5,000mAh battery supporting 45W wired fast charging and runs on Android 14 with One UI 6.1 and 'Galaxy AI' features. It also includes a built-in S Pen stylus and offers 7 years of OS and security updates.",
      "price": "Price varies by storage configuration, released January 2024. Expected to be higher than the Pixel 9 Pro.",
      "review_rating": null,
      "review_pros": [

        "Versatile quad-camera system with 200MP main lens and 5x telephoto",

        "Built-in S Pen stylus for productivity and remote camera control",
        "Superior thermal management and robust performance for demanding tasks",
        "5,000mAh battery with 45W wired fast charging, 15W wireless, and 4.5W reverse wireless charging",
        "7 years of OS and security updates",
        "Galaxy AI features like live call translation"

      "description": "The Google Pixel 9 Pro is expected to feature a 6.3-inch 'Super Actua' OLED display with 2K resolution (2856 x 1280 pixels), a 120Hz variable refresh rate, and a 3000 nits peak brightness. It is powered by Google's Tensor G4 processor and features a triple camera system with a 50MP main camera, a 48MP ultrawide, and a 48MP telephoto lens, along with a 42MP selfie camera.
